Data Gatherer
  • <no title>
  • View page source
class data_gatherer.orchestrator.Orchestrator(config_path='config.json', log_file_override=None)

This class orchestrates the data gathering process by coordinating the data fetcher, parser, and classifier in a single workflow.

deduplicate_links(classified_links)

Deduplicates the classified links based on the link / download_link itself. If two entry share the same link or if download link of record A is the same as link of record B, merge rows.

Parameters:

classified_links – DataFrame of classified links.

display_data_preview(metadata, display_type='console', interactive=True)

Display extracted metadata as a clean table in both Jupyter and terminal environments. – future release

download_previewed_data_resources(output_root='output/suppl_files')

Function to download all the files – future release

get_data_preview(combined_df, display_type='console', interactive=True, return_metadata=False)

Shows user a preview of the data they are about to download. – future release

process_url(url, save_staging_table=False)

Orchestrates the process for a single given source URL (publication).

  1. Fetches raw data using the data fetcher (WebScraper or APIClient).

  2. Parses the raw data using the parser (LLMParser).

  3. Collects Metadata.

  4. Classifies the parsed data using the classifier (LLMClassifier).

param url: The URL to process.

param save_staging_table: Flag to save the staging table.

process_urls(url_list, log_modulo=10)

Processes a list of URLs and returns classified data.

Parameters:

  • url_list – List of URLs to process.

  • log_modulo – Frequency of logging progress (useful when url_list is long).

Returns:

Dictionary with URLs as keys and DataFrames of classified data as values.

run()

Main method to run the Orchestrator simple workflow: 1. Setup data fetcher (web scraper or API client) 2. Load URLs from config 3. Process each URL and return results as a dictionary like source_url: DataFrame_of_data_links 4. Write results to output file specified in configuration file

setup_data_fetcher()

Sets up either a web scraper or API client based on the config.
